hero.title: Golf in Queenstown
hero.subtitle: World-class courses framed by mountains, lakes, and Central Otago vineyards. Tee off at sunrise with The Remarkables as your backdrop.

courses.name: Millbrook Resort
courses.description: 27-hole championship course designed by Sir Bob Charles. Set against the Remarkables with autumn colour that rivals Augusta. The Coronet Nine is the signature — a par-3 over water with the mountains as a backdrop.
courses.bestTime: Autumn mornings — golden light, no wind, empty fairways
courses.localTip: Book the 7:15am tee time. You'll have the course to yourself and finish in time for lunch at the Millhouse.
courses.operatorNote: Cart included in green fee. Twilight rates after 3pm from Nov-Mar.

courses.name: Frankton Golf Centre
courses.description: Relaxed 9-hole course with views of The Remarkables and Lake Wakatipu. No booking required — just show up. Perfect for a casual round between activities.
courses.bestTime: Late afternoon in summer — warm, golden, quiet
courses.localTip: Bring your own clubs if you can. Rental sets are basic. The 7th hole views are worth the walk alone.
courses.operatorNote: Open dawn to dusk. No booking needed — walk on anytime.

courses.name: Jack's Point Golf Course
courses.description: Ranked #1 in NZ by Golf Digest multiple times. John Darby designed this links-style course that plays along the shores of Lake Wakatipu with The Remarkables towering above. Holes 14-16 along the lake are unforgettable.
courses.bestTime: Early autumn — still warm, no wind, shoulder season rates
courses.localTip: The lakeside holes (14-16) are the money shots. If you only have time for 9, play the back nine.
courses.operatorNote: Booking essential. 7-day advance booking recommended in summer. Club hire available.

courses.name: Arrowtown Golf Club
courses.description: Charming 18-hole course nestled in the Arrowtown basin. Tree-lined fairways, mountain views, and a genuine small-town golf club atmosphere. The clubhouse bacon butty is legendary.
courses.bestTime: Autumn — the deciduous trees lining the fairways turn gold
courses.localTip: Play in April when the trees turn. It's one of the most photogenic rounds you'll ever play. Stay for the bacon butty.
courses.operatorNote: Visitors welcome any day. Book 48hrs ahead in summer. Club hire $30.

courses.name: Queenstown Golf Club
courses.description: 18-hole lakefront course on the Kelvin Heights peninsula. The most scenic course in town — surrounded by water on three sides with 360° mountain views. The water taxi from Queenstown Bay adds to the experience.
courses.bestTime: Morning round, any season — the lake is glassy before 10am
courses.localTip: Take the water taxi from Queenstown Bay (10 mins). It's the most scenic commute to any golf course in the world.
courses.operatorNote: Water taxi available from Queenstown Bay. Book tee times online.

courses.name: The Hills
courses.description: Ultra-exclusive course sculpted into the Wakatipu Basin hills. Known for its dramatic landscape art installations between holes. Limited visitor access — but if you can get on, it's bucket-list golf.
courses.bestTime: Late summer — long golden evenings, art installations glow
courses.localTip: The only way on is through a member or by staying at certain partner lodges. Ask your accommodation if they have a relationship.
courses.operatorNote: Private club. Guest access via member introduction or partner lodge bookings.

summer.label: Peak Season
summer.notes: Long days, warm conditions. Book ahead — courses are busy. Early AM and twilight rounds are magic.

autumn.label: Best Season
autumn.notes: Locals' favourite. Golden trees, calm mornings, empty courses. March is perfection. April brings autumn festival.

winter.label: Quiet Season
winter.notes: Cold but clear. Frost delays common before 10am. Courses are empty and green fees drop. Snow on the mountains makes every hole a postcard.

spring.label: Shoulder Season
spring.notes: Courses greening up, warming days. Some rain but great value. September can be wet, October is ideal.

communityTips.author: Dave McPherson
communityTips.text: If you're only playing one course, make it Jack's Point. But if you want the authentic local experience, Arrowtown Golf Club on an autumn morning with a bacon butty afterwards is hard to beat.

communityTips.author: Tom Richardson
communityTips.text: We played 4 courses in 3 days — Millbrook, Jack's Point, Queenstown Golf Club, and Arrowtown. Each completely different. I'd add an extra day just for golf next time.

communityTips.author: Sarah Chen
communityTips.text: The water taxi to Queenstown Golf Club is a must-do even if you don't play golf. 10 minutes across the lake, stunning views. My partner plays while I walk the Kelvin Heights trail.

communityTips.author: Craig & Wendy
communityTips.text: We came for 3 days of skiing but it rained. Played Frankton instead — $35 for 9 holes with Remarkables views. Best rainy day backup we've ever had.

itineraryIdeas.title: The 3-Day Golf Trail
days: Millbrook Resort (27 holes) + lunch at the Millhouse
Jack's Point (18 holes) + Gibbston wine tasting
Arrowtown Golf Club (18 holes) + historic village walk
itineraryIdeas.tip: Book accommodation in Arrowtown — you're central to 3 of the 4 best courses.

itineraryIdeas.title: Golf & Wine Weekend
days: Jack's Point morning round + Gibbston Valley cellar doors afternoon
Queenstown Golf Club via water taxi + waterfront dinner
itineraryIdeas.tip: The Queenstown Trail cycling path connects the courses. Rent e-bikes.

itineraryIdeas.title: Casual Golf Day
days: Frankton Golf Centre (9 holes, walk-on) + Remarkables Park lunch + Queenstown Gardens frisbee golf
itineraryIdeas.tip: No booking needed for either. Great for families or a half-day activity.

stayLonger.stat: Golfers who play 3+ courses rate their Queenstown trip 52% higher
stayLonger.nudge: Most golfers come for 2 days and wish they'd booked 4. Each course is completely different — lake, mountain, vineyard, bush. You need at least 3 rounds to get the full picture.
